messages.content:
Dear
Do you think Britain is heading in the right direction?
Theresa May has been PM for less than a year and we’ve already seen the worst hospitals crisis in a decade. Local schools are facing crippling cuts to funding. She’s delivering the worst kind of Brexit.
But she’s getting away with it because Labour have become the worst opposition in living memory.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Local schools are facing crippling cuts to funding.
As your MP, I led the campaign to save Guy’s Hospital when the Tories threatened to close it (and when Labour closed the A&E department).
Now I am fighting for new stops on the Bakerloo line, the Rotherhithe to Canary Wharf bridge and for genuinely affordable homes for local people.
Theresa May’s disastrous Brexit. The Liberal Democrats offer a brighter future for Britain and will be a real opposition to Theresa May’s disastrous Brexit.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Elections here are always between the Liberal Democrats and Labour.

issues.brexitEurope: Theresa May is delivering the worst kind of Brexit. The Liberal Democrats offer a brighter future for Britain and will be a real opposition to Theresa May’s disastrous Brexit.
issues.education: Local schools are facing crippling cuts to funding.

community.content: Now I am fighting for new stops on the Bakerloo line, the Rotherhithe to Canary Wharf bridge and for genuinely affordable homes for local people.

leaflet.personalStatement: In Bermondsey & Old Southwark, I am proud of my record over 32 years as your MP and am proud to be putting myself forward to serve our community once again.

politicalExperience.achievements: Led the campaign to save Guy’s Hospital and delivered the Jubilee Line extension to Southwark and Bermondsey.

Do you think Britain is heading in the right direction?
Local schools are facing crippling cuts to funding.
She’s delivering the worst kind of Brexit.
But she’s getting away with it because Labour have become the worst opposition in living memory.
Now I am fighting for new stops on the Bakerloo line, the Rotherhithe to Canary Wharf bridge and for genuinely affordable homes for local people.
Theresa May has been PM for less than a year and we’ve already seen the worst hospitals crisis in a decade.
